intro: Lavatera brachyfolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved woollypod, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, fluffy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus. Lavatera brachyfolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
